page.title: 14Roman Roads, Hailey.
page.content: Three Roman Roads cross our area. The most important and interesting one is Akeman Street, running from southwest to northeast, joining the forts of St. Albans (Verillanium) and Cirencester (Corinium). At New Found Out Farm there is a Roman cross road where Whiteway (St.John's Path) and Pay Lane meet Akeman Street. If you follow Whiteway to the south east you can still see some rounded Roman cobble stones, set on edge, which could lead to an old villa, though no trace remains. Pay Lane leads to the northwest, to- wards Greenwitch Lane, near Brizes Lodge Farm, where Roman pottery has been discovered. All these roads are now bridleway except the narrow tarred Akeman Street between New Foun Out Farm and Ramsden.
